intro: Sticherus bolanicus, commonly known as the Bolan sticherus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the arid regions of Pakistan and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Sticherus bolanicus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
